conclusion: Plan to analyze the image and reason through the effects of a light source moving upward on shadows.
The image shows four objects on a textured surface: an apple, a piece of paper, a chicken leg, and a shadow labeled 'C'. Each object casts a shadow on the ground.
Identify the objects and their shadows: The apple, paper, chicken leg, and shadow labeled 'C' are present.
Understand the effect of a light source moving upward: As the light source moves upward, the angle of the light rays will change.
This change will cause the shadows to move and change in size.
Shadow A (apple): Will move upward and possibly become smaller.
Shadow B (paper): Will move upward and possibly become smaller.
Shadow C: Will move upward and possibly become smaller.
Shadow D (chicken leg): Will move upward and possibly become smaller.
Conclude the changes in position and size of the shadows.
When the light source moves upward, the shadows of the four objects will also move upward. Additionally, the size of the shadows may change.
The shadows will become smaller as the light source moves further away from the objects.
The position and size of the shadows A, B, C, and D will change due to the movement of the light source.
